Networking

Class PlayerPeer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Networking.PlayerPeer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class PlayerPeer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Closeable

    Provides network communication with an instance of player application (peer) based on TCP protocol.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerPeer

        public PlayerPeer(java.net.Socket socket)
        Constructs a PlayerPeer(java.net.Socket) object with specified socket. After verifying connection (getting edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages#MSG_INIT_CONNECTION from peer) and getting from peer the player identity initializes player as a new Player object with Player.identity set to the received value. Then sets state to PeerState.CONNECTED and sends peer conformation of connection (edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages#MSG_CONNECTION_EST).
        Parameters:
        socket -

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Active listens for peer. Calls Player.applyForAnswer of player when receives edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages#MSG_ANSWER_APPLYING (sent by player application when player applies for answer). Calls Game.finishGame() when receives edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages#MSG_CONNECTION_TERM (peer terminates connection).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendMsg

        public void sendMsg(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends the specified message to peer.
        Parameters:
        msg - desired message.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages#MSG_CONNECTION_TERM to peer.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
